title: Ralph auto-catchup on partial story progress
description: When an iteration starts and the current story has partial progress (some criteria checked but not all), Ralph should automatically help Claude catch up on what was done. This prevents redoing work when iterations get cut mid-story.

acceptanceCriteria.text: Detect partial progress: story has checked criteria but passes=false
When partial progress detected, add catchup context to prompt:
- Run: git diff HEAD~1 --name-only (files changed last iteration)
- Include: 'Previous iteration made progress. Review changes before continuing.'
Add to Claude prompt: list of checked vs unchecked criteria
Consider: --no-catchup flag to skip this behavior
Test: Partially complete a story, restart Ralph, verify catchup context shown
Test: Fresh story (0 checked) should NOT trigger catchup
Commit changes with message: feat/fix: [STORY-ID] description
